page.title: 15A Day in the Life of A.Blair
page.content: (cont.from p.14) on a Friday only,I meet the{0723}United bus which brings me over 400 copies of Allendales favourite newspaper,the Hexham Courant.From now until about{8.50}it is a race against the clock to "mark up" all the daily papers which are ordered,at the same time serving children of aal shapes and sizes who swarm into the shop scrambling for sweets,crisps and pop to help them through another day. Hopefully,at about{8.30}If have finished the papers,my wife comes into the shop and I go upstairs for a quick "wash and brush" and then,if a school day, I see Martin (my son) across the road to school. Back into the shop for{9.00}_ this time to the Post Office counter.Straight into the safe and out with my stamps,postal orders,money etc
